Posted By: Dragasm (7/5/2012 5:34:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Most people look at this and say "Meh, only good in a lifegain deck." While it won't be seeing any high end tourney play, don't underestimate this card. By turn seven, any white deck worth it's salt will have at least ten to fifteen life. A 15/15 beater is nothing to scoff at, the fact that you get it back when it dies is icing on the cake.  
  
And yes, this is amazing in Commander. That alone makes it deserve 4/5 stars.
posts.html:
Most people look at this and say "Meh, only good in a lifegain deck." While it won't be seeing any high end tourney play, don't underestimate this card. By turn seven, any white deck worth it's salt will have at least ten to fifteen life. A 15/15 beater is nothing to scoff at, the fact that you get it back when it dies is icing on the cake.

And yes, this is amazing in Commander. That alone makes it deserve 4/5 stars.

Posted By: Regal_Unicorn (7/8/2012 3:40:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Regal\_Unicorn: That ability is generally considered a drawback. Large creatures like this are usually reanimated into play with a card such as [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead). This stops any of that from happening. Desirable creatures like [Emrakul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul) and [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) have this same ability.  
  
(If you really want to be pedantic about it, Progenitus' ability is actually slightly different in that it's a replacement effect and this one is a triggered ability)
posts.html:
@Regal_Unicorn: That ability is generally considered a drawback. Large creatures like this are usually reanimated into play with a card such as Animate Dead. This stops any of that from happening. Desirable creatures like Emrakul and Progenitus have this same ability.

(If you really want to be pedantic about it, Progenitus' ability is actually slightly different in that it's a replacement effect and this one is a triggered ability)
